title: Opioids are overrated for some common back pain, a study suggests
description: New research calls into question prescribing the drugs even for short-term pain relief – especially given the risk of addiction.

title: Domestic terrorism charges in Georgia are prompting concern over political repression
description: In Atlanta, dozens of activists who oppose a new police and fire training facility are being accused of domestic terrorism. That has alarmed civil liberties and human rights groups.

title: Western tribes' last ditch effort to stall a large lithium mine in Nevada
description: Western tribes are making a last ditch effort to thwart a large lithium mine in a federal appeals court.

title: Madonna postpones tour while recovering from 'serious bacterial infection'
description: The 64-year-old singer's latest tour, "Celebration," was supposed to kick off in mid-July. As a result of the illness, which put her in a hospital ICU, Madonna has postponed her international tour.

title: Biden's sleep apnea has led him to use a CPAP machine at night
description: After reporters noticed marks on the president's face Wednesday morning, the White House disclosed that the president started using a CPAP machine a few weeks ago.

title: How to laugh in the face of sorrow: Insights from a Lebanese sweets shop owner
description: Nassim Haddad has seen his share of disaster and loss. At 79, he says of his philosophy: "I start again from the beginning. I start from zero. I [am not] afraid from anything."

title: Simone Biles and Sunisa Lee to return to competition, with 2024 in their sights
description: Biles hasn't competed since the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, when she withdrew and spurred a global conversation on the pressures faced by athletes. Lee stepped into the spotlight and won all-around gold.

title: A police chief who became a serial arsonist is sentenced to life terms, plus 75 years
description: Surveillance video showed the Maryland arsonist gushing gasoline on homes before lighting fires that were sometimes explosive. One entry on his "target list" read simply, "White Privilege."

title: 78 people face charges for $2.5 billion in attempted health care fraud, DOJ says
description: At least $1.1 billion was actually paid out in these schemes targeting elderly patients, high-risk and low-income pregnant women and HIV patients.

title: How school systems, educators and parents can support transgender children
description: Aidan Key explains why U.S. schools are seeing an increase in transgender students and how educators can respond to anti-LGBTQ curriculum measures. His book is Trans Children in Today's Schools.

title: Air quality plummets as Canadian wildfire smoke stretches across the Midwest
description: Chicago saw its air quality plummet, while other cities including Detroit, Milwaukee and Pittsburgh were experiencing unhealthy air quality levels.

title: An original Princess Leia dress found in an attic could be yours — for as much as $2M
description: Film crews though the gown, worn by Carrie Fisher's character, had been destroyed after the production wrapped. Now it's up for sale alongside 1,400 other items at a Hollywood auction.

title: If you love film, you should be worried about what's going on at Turner Classic Movies
description: Warner Bros. Discovery recently announced a shake-up at the network, which for years has offered a well curated film selection. Critic David Bianculli says TCM wasn't broken — and didn't need fixing.

title: 3 YA fantasy novels for summer that bring out the monsters within
description: As we roll into the dog days of summer, these three YA novels move beyond being beastly — as their protagonists transform into the creatures that lie within.

title: Detroit, Chicago and the Midwest blanketed by wildfire haze from Canada
description: Smoke from Canadian wildfires is smothering U.S. cities like Detroit, Chicago and Pittsburgh. Air quality warnings are in effect across the Midwest as officials warn of hazardous conditions.

title: Up First briefing: Extreme heat; pandemic fraud; Supreme Court election theory ruling
description: The South faces record-breaking heat. Over $200 billion in pandemic business loans appear to be fraudulent. The Supreme Court rejects the controversial independant state leglistatures theory.

title: Global heat waves show climate change and El Niño are a bad combo
description: Scientists say worsening heat waves have a clear link to climate change. This year, a seasonal El Niño pattern will also be adding fuel to the fire.

title: Supreme Court ethics v. pride, prejudice and political movers and shakers
description: The problem for the justices is that all the recent ethics stories — and more — are a corrosive drip, drip, drip, eroding public confidence in the court.

title: A mother's understanding of her son is transformed with a single phone call
description: Barbara spent years trying to understand her son's difficult behavior. Then someone said something that made her realize that it was no one's fault.

title: Nearly 2,000 migrants have died crossing the Mediterranean this year. Here's why
description: Flimsy boats, E.U. policies and an increase in migrants attempting the crossing are some of the factors converging to make this year an especially deadly one.

title: What the Supreme Court's rejection of a controversial theory means for elections
description: The U.S. Supreme Court's decision to reject the most extreme version of the "independent state legislature theory" is expected to bring some stability to the 2024 elections — and invite more lawsuits.

title: In Texas, a rare program offers hope for some of the most vulnerable women and babies
description: Many pregnant people struggling with substance abuse don't want to get help for fear of losing their children to the state. Casa Mía offers safe harbor.

title: The Bud Light boycott shows brands are at a crossroads: Use their voice, or shut up?
description: Large companies have played the role of activists and been one of the biggest countervailing forces against social and religious conservatives on LGBTQ measures. All that is at stake now.

title: At least 8 dead, including children, from a Russian missile strike in eastern Ukraine
description: The restaurant in the city of Kramatorsk took a direct hit on Tuesday night. Rescue crews searched through the night and feared more people could be buried in the debris.

title: That's no pizza: A wall painting found in Pompeii doesn't depict Italy's iconic dish
description: A fresco discovered at the Pompeii archaeological site looks like a pizza, but it's not, experts say. Tomatoes and mozzarella were not available when the fresco was painted some 2,000 years ago.

title: NASCAR great Jimmie Johnson's in-laws found shot to death in Oklahoma
description: Police in Muskogee, Oklahoma, confirmed Tuesday they are investigating the shooting deaths of three relatives of seven-time NASCAR champion Jimmie Johnson.
